page.title: 15THE ELM TREE
page.content: Latchingdon School planted an elm tree in 1982 on Tuesday May 25th. Our elm tree was planted because most of the elm trees have been killed off by Dutch Elm Disease so we planted it in the hope that it would not die because it was a special American type.In the first year it's height was 1m 90cm.In the second year it was 2m 37\cm and now it's height is 2m 35cm!Somehow it has shrunk!In the beginning of the second year of our elm tree some rabbits had been chewing the bottom of the tree,so there is some wire netting round the bottom of the tree now.There are 23 other trees around our school. They are mainly small trees but there is one big tree inside and one big tree just outside the school.The big trees are Yew trees and the others are all different types.
